document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended English Language Proficiency

85B084ED53A148B5B03F77073AC5719E.description:
respond to simple questions (e.g., yes
or no, wh- questions).

AD66F55ABA7045879E86B452EDA9DE35.description:
recognize and use a small number of
frequently occurring nouns, noun
phrases and verbs.

B197E0C307F84FD59FCB2BD0D02B4813.description:
produce simple and compound
sentences on familiar topics.

3941D997839B48CE9DD70EAAF3FB0B8A.description:
recognize and use a small number of
nouns, pronouns, verbs, prepositions,
adjectives, adverbs, conjunctions and
prepositional phrases.

3741B25956EA45C6BC46DD4957E6DEF1.description:
produce simple, compound and
complex sentences on familiar topics.

43B2366A3E6D4CAC804CDA8A51B21DD8.description:
recognize and use an increasing
number of nouns, pronouns, verbs,
prepositions, adjectives, adverbs,
conjunctions and prepositional phrases.

A6B532D5DB6A4C858382FC02538E533A.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
make accurate use of standard
English to communicate in grade-appropriate speech and writing.

327CBC1445B34B98BAE5E5C13B808B58.description:
use a narrow range of frequently
occurring vocabulary and simple
sentences with limited control.

4772C3E75CF74B3A88FEE4677E67F532.description:
communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.

DE533B56DCFB43A68F079CD398DD8B82.description:
connect phrases or simple statements
using some frequently occurring linking
and temporal words and some common
transitional words with emerging
control.

A7ED77F444BE4577B2C8C360199163CB.description: retell a short sequence of events.

56BB3105A191484BB8CFA5D0182668C6.description:
communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.

055178A4B36849D9A4ECBB58C8E59077.description:
use an increasing range of linking and
temporal words and common
transitional words and phrases with
increasing control.

4DAED8C556F24CF79ACD05F29441A0F0.description:
retell a sequence of events or steps in
a process.

AC529481C2E54CA9B47809883094D020.description:
communicate a few pieces of
information about a familiar topic.

3560C142502848AFB25CA1AD0464950D.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
create clear and coherent grade-appropriate speech and text.

5F8FECEB02E6494FB4D2DACE891EDB77.description:
recognize the meaning of a few
frequently occurring words, phrases
and expressions in texts about familiar
topics, experiences or events.

02995825533C438F902E2273F6D603F3.description:
With prompting and support and relying
some on context, visual aids, reference
materials and communicative experience:

D2048A90771C4CBE9C243C9E06C48F0C.description:
determine the meaning of general
academic and content-specific words
and frequently occurring expressions in
texts about familiar topics, experiences
or events.

9DFD72B09B6A4848B4C38FC01C0B2FC0.description:
With prompting and support and relying
some on context, visual aids, reference
materials and communicative experience:

D3B3F3F5652A4BFD8D75F52A4CDB2B96.description:
determine the meaning of general
academic and content-specific words
and a growing number of expressions
in texts about a variety of topics,
experiences or events.

3B8C1F30728C496AAF5779B1A72A3BD6.description:
With prompting and support and using
context, visual aids, reference materials and
knowledge of English:

C5A818C0F0A04C64B2A2FB7113212D6D.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
determine the meaning of words
and phrases in oral presentations
and literary and informational text.

AD511AE3B67744F5A6DC5003D14FC8A1.description:
recognize the meaning of some words
learned through conversations, reading
and being read to.

BD4CC43ED90C491BA3E4187F424A7E04.description:
use some frequently occurring general
academic and content-specific words and
phrases showing developing control in
speech and writing.

955F57AA1DF648B58EAF9A282F61E71B.description:
use language appropriate for a task and
audience.

2742664685D045F196FF6B341F40D77F.description:
use an increasing number of general
academic and content-specific words and
phrases showing increasing control in
speech and writing.

B0F002A457EF433EB5E35B602F68009F.description:
use language appropriate for a purpose,
task and audience.

E2CDF1844A2E4D458978419466CD45B7.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
adapt language choices to
purpose, task, and audience when
speaking and writing.

2271E92F2520422F83A5E4E479C21760.description:
identify a point an author or speaker
makes.

3BB19DD6B4B54DE1AD422A107A3908C3.description:
identify a reason an author or speaker
gives to support a main idea.

D0C14CF4232A4EAFBF373033C0DF4B30.description:
identify a main point an author or speaker
makes.

690AC9FEDEE54BB8995815B8CF49B9BB.description:
indicate whether author or speaker’s
main point is supported or not.

422D95ADC624437BA425B311977C7503.description:
retell the main point an author or speaker
makes.

F06A0A810AA6436D9AF8804EF59AC2B0.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
analyze and critique the arguments
of others orally and in writing.

FBBA728CED1941859362600AD57BB41A.description:
gather information from a few provided
sources.

D5A02E73423344D9834937C46001DE85.description:
retell information, using labeled
illustrations, diagrams or other graphics,
as appropriate.

2F95174DC66D49CF908C74748B0F9406.description:
record some information from provided
sources.

34B512DE3B3F4DBEA4AD30B33756BD03.description:
gather information from some provided
sources.

183B2A544A134260B2AF2D6E79966F10.description:
gather information from several provided
sources.

6A35D6D215844E4181E3B103024731FB.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
conduct research and evaluate and
communicate findings to answer
questions or solve problems

B64B3ED9CB4F4F769405BB007B1F58E2.description: express an opinion about a familiar topic.

7B53DF44BFCB48CCB3F87D1B906B144D.description:
provide one or two reasons or facts to
support the information about a familiar
topic.

D108F66CF1364D2A92C08200648576CB.description: provide information about a familiar topic.

49BE665992E84735926BD7BE2784CEBF.description:
provide a few reasons or facts to support
the information about a familiar topic.

C90DCEFBB39D45C1B3A200133D464793.description: provide information about a familiar topic.

C2F2C29A5C9946789D3AA57F90033833.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct grade-appropriate oral
and written claims and support
them with reasoning and evidence.

B620598570A64851A5A7A3D5FEF955B7.description:
about familiar texts, topics and
experiences.

FFEC60BD3C5244AFA89581CE3C522D30.description:
about familiar texts, topics and
experiences.

2895015DB0A64D2F8FC22CB5FAB63F9C.description:
about familiar texts, topics and
experiences.

80C67A72CEA644EB942F6F732B787A9D.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
speak and write about grade-appropriate complex literary and
informational texts and topics.

D84D9BD96A834F1CA31B0C38B271DEFC.description:
respond to simple questions about
familiar topics and texts.

58CC9103FC7A4A13A393849EC520EEC2.description:
respond to simple questions and some
wh- questions about familiar topics and
texts.

8E59FA73B18F4D3B82B903777ABCD483.description:
respond to the ideas of others or express
one’s own ideas about familiar topics and
texts.

4184D4F0E05C45CEBF1101DA467DB884.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
participate in grade-appropriate oral
and written exchanges of
information, ideas, and analyses,
responding to peer, audience, or
reader comments and questions.

A8850B27E38C42A5A7E39FF1FD37D568.description:
identify a few key words and phrases in
oral communications and simple written
texts.

FDB5B1511C3145AEBDBA4EB0B30C0E95.description:
With prompting and support, use a very
limited set of strategies to:

5EA735D4C05A4992A7E89E8EB53C4EC9.description:
identify the main topic in and retell a few
key details from oral communications and
simple written texts.

B16DE1D85CFD42F1A157C12402CFDBB8.description:
With prompting and support, use an
emerging set of strategies to:

9365E9ED294D4A279300D72A71F5D4B3.description:
identify supporting details and how they
support central ideas or themes in oral
presentations or simple written texts.

74571ECDCF89403582D4A13BDFD0D537.description:
identify two or more central ideas or
themes in oral presentations or simple
written texts.

C47DA806EAD34733BD219594CF45E43A.description:
summarize information from oral
communications or simple written texts.

962F0805772D46C0AF1CBAA1BB4A8C47.description:
With prompting and support, use an
increasing range of strategies to:

9E07DF08EC7E43E0AB05B424632066D0.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct meaning from oral
presentations and literary and
informational text through grade-appropriate listening, reading, and
viewing.
